text:
@SanjatKanjilal @CarlosdelRio7 @DrToddLee @MatthewPCheng @roby_bhatt Wonderful being on-service with you in July of your 1st yr fellowship! Since then you've carved out a critical position at BWH as #1 link between ID & micro lab. Thanks for your tireless work during #COVID19! 
But breaks important ... several 10 min walks/day a good start.

Today was supposed to be Opening Day for the 2020 baseball season, but #COVID19 had other ideas -- which makes me sad. (Acknowledged -- a very minor thing in the context of all this suffering.) Writing this was therapeutic, thank you. https://t.co/0R0LuxVgIG

If you don't mind hearing me say "we just don't know" a lot, these @thecurbsiders folks do a great job asking excellent practical questions about #COVID19. Shout-out at the end to @HelenBranswell & @sciencecohen for their outstanding and balanced coverage. https://t.co/rHtn9lYKIT

I told @ErinMcCreary and @jpogue1 that a review of #COVID treatment might have a shelf-life between milk and yogurt, so it had to be done FAST. And wow were they fast -- and it's great! @SIDPharm @IDSAInfo  https://t.co/3nPDohocoK
A giant in the ID/HIV field, Mike Saag shares his experience with COVID-19 here. His book is pretty great, too! https://t.co/jGdOyjwFe4 https://t.co/OifXmJO9CJ

Testing positive for other pathogens might reduce the risk of #COVID19 -- but might not do so enough to warrant excluding the diagnosis.

Solution will be to incorporate testing for #COVID19 into multiplex respiratory panels. 

What is the timeline to make this happen? https://t.co/wZvKVjeHmd

People ask whether air travel is safe right now from a #COVIDãƒ¼19 perspective. Counterintuitively, it's the flight portion of the trip that is now likely the safest--many empty seats, control over your environment, air is completely replaced 15 times an hour. 

But ... https://t.co/gNzGZr9ycv

#Testgate anyone? Sure, why not.
'I don't take responsibility at all': Trump deflects blame for coronavirus testing fumble  https://t.co/tmYeYEqpRr via @politico

Credit to @FelgerAndMazz -- their questions on #COVID19 were excellent -- both sports and non-sports related. (Interview at minute 12). Thanks for the chance to be on sports radio, too bad we couldn't have been talking about baseball.
https://t.co/f8INueNOCN

With commercial and academic labs gearing up to expand #COVID19 testing in the USA, cases are soon going to go up A LOT. A (rough) estimate about where we are now, and plea for a sensible response to the increase. (h/t @splette for the figure.) Latest: https://t.co/4eLn4vfvc7

Once #COVID19 testing in the USA (finally) becomes widely available, how will we -- clinicians, scientists, journalists, public -- respond to the inevitable substantial increase in diagnosed cases? Any predictions? Very curious.
If you read only one thing today, read this thread -- because we could all use a breather from #COVID19 sometimes! #medtwitter #IDtwitter @SaxCarolyn https://t.co/YqJGqURcFL

If you're in ID right now, you know that life is ... kind of nutty. Tried to outline a bit what it's like. 
What Does (And Doesn't) Scare Me About The Coronavirus https://t.co/JVdodji0IV via @commonhealth
